org.littleshoot.proxy.test

Class HttpClientUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.littleshoot.proxy.test.HttpClientUtil

  • public class HttpClientUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for creating HTTP clients and sending requests to servers via a LittleProxy instance.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpClientUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static org.apache.http.HttpResponse performHttpGet(java.lang.String url, HttpProxyServer proxyServer)
      Creates a new HTTP client that uses the specified LittleProxy instance to perform a GET to the specified URL.
      static org.apache.http.HttpResponse performHttpPost(java.lang.String url, int postSizeInBytes, HttpProxyServer proxyServer)
      Creates a new HTTP client that uses the specified LittleProxy instance to perform a POST of the specified size to to the URL.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpClientUtil

        public HttpClientUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • performHttpGet

        public static org.apache.http.HttpResponse performHttpGet(java.lang.String url,
                                                          HttpProxyServer proxyServer)
        Creates a new HTTP client that uses the specified LittleProxy instance to perform a GET to the specified URL. The HTTP client is closed and discarded after the request is completed.
        Parameters:
        url - URL to post to
        proxyServer - LittleProxy instance through which the GET will be proxied
        Returns:
        the HttpResponse object encapsulating the response from the server

      • performHttpPost

        public static org.apache.http.HttpResponse performHttpPost(java.lang.String url,
                                                           int postSizeInBytes,
                                                           HttpProxyServer proxyServer)
        Creates a new HTTP client that uses the specified LittleProxy instance to perform a POST of the specified size to to the URL. The POST body will consist of a meaningless UTF-8-encoded String (currently, the letter 'q'). The HTTP client is closed and discarded after the request is completed.
        Parameters:
        url - URL to post to
        postSizeInBytes - size of the POST body
        proxyServer - LittleProxy instance through which the POST will be proxied
        Returns:
        the HttpResponse from the server
